comment: HORRIBLE!! Expected to read 80 pages in one night. Completely unorganized. She didn't know how to work D2L for the first half of the semester, so no one knew what assignments we had. I didn't receive any grades until exam week. She showed up 15 minutes late and one time didn't show up at all. Would switch to online 30 minutes before class started.
Not organized at all. So much reading where the textbooks are very biased. Only one assignment a week other than readings, but it is a few paragraphs on the readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I think she's just new; so she hasn't quite got the hang of it. She's a nice woman, but can be challenging to get a hold of. She does take a while to grade assignments, but typically gives a fair curve. I'm sure she will be better in the next few semesters; she just needs to gain experience. Not horrible, but definetely struggled a bit.

I took this class thinking it would be an easy A, however I was wrong. First of all, this professor takes 4-6 weeks to grade assignments, I still have assignments from the first month of school that haven't been graded, takes a long time to respond to emails, and added random assignments that weren't in the syllabus. Please avoid this professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: You would think this class wouldn't be too bad, but this professor makes it WAY harder than it should be. You have to do lots of textbook reading, but the assignments themselves aren't too bad. The reason this professor is so terrible is that she takes WAY too long to grade them. I'm getting grades in now I should have gotten 2 months ago.

Professor was absurdly slow to grade most assignments & then was bizarrely tough at grading them.  Discussion posts were graded like formal essays, but it took 4-6 weeks to get grades back.    No video lectures were recorded. This class started out a mess and became a nightmare. Don't take this class, just read the textbooks to teach yourself.
Syllabus dont match reality. Frustrating ash. Dont grade either. class is tarded.

Teacher seemed to care about her class but was disorganized and ill at ease with the KSU D2L platform.  Be prepared to read almost every page of the massive textbooks. Quizzes were shockingly hard and grading was often delayed for weeks.    This is an interesting course but don't expect it to be an "Easy A".   You will need to read/write a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: She's a sweet person and passionate about the subject she teaches, but the class itself was poorly thought out and very disorganized. All of our work was discussion-based group work, and we had a group project for our final. in her defense, she is a new professor and this was her first time teaching a class. Hopefully she improves in the future.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework
